description:
We are seeking a highly motivated, energetic System Architect to lead and drive system technical designs and roadmaps. You will oversee and analyze key system architectural and implementation trade-offs such as power and performance in a thermally constrained system, analyzing silicon, data flows and driving requirements.

This role requires that you have strong communication, persuasion and negotiation skills, in addition to being comfortable with working through ambiguities. You will have the opportunity to work with other engineers for the best standards, methodologies, and practices in systems development.

• Decompose user facing features, experiences and functions into associated enabling technologies and modules.
• Lay out available architectural options, analyze engineering trade-offs and articulate recommendations to meet product goals.
• Work cross-functionally to understand existing portfolio of modules and technologies, derive capabilities and cost functions, and construct an overall end-to-end product solution.
• Drive cross-functional alignment through technical discussions, negotiations and executive reviews.
• Define and author system level feature descriptions and detailed functional requirements.
• Shepherd product feature through the full product life-cycle: concept to product release.
• Review, influence and challenge architectural tradeoffs with data and innovative new ideas
preferred_qualifications:
Proven expertise in SoC architecture, low-power design, HW/SW interfaces, bus protocols, and wireless interfaces.
Working knowledge of HW/SW interaction, operating systems, estimation of compute workload, thermal and power controls in modern SoCs.
Previous exposure to PCB technologies, signal integrity considerations, coex/desense mitigation
Working experience with complex systems containing motion sensing, computer vision and sensor fusion elements
Previous exposure to various display technologies (LCD, OLED, LBS) and associated optical systems
